result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daveon Kurryonta Pinkston

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. DPA Violation Report 11.1.2022

Defendant Daveon Kurryonta Pinkston in court.  Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court for Daveon Kurryonta Pinkston.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court due to the court being in receipt of JusticePoint violation report. Parties discussed the violation. Case adjourned to Branch 17 for a review hearing on November 14th, 2022 at 2:45 pm.

Defendant Daveon Kurryonta Pinkston in court.  Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court for Daveon Kurryonta Pinkston.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case in court to address violation. Court admonishes defendant. Case remains calendared for review hearing on 11-14-2022 at 2:45 pm, Branch 17.
DPA Violation Report, received and filed

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit. Defendant to comply with all conditions of the DPA.

Defendant Daveon Kurryonta Pinkston in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement/
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire & Addendum
